alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 9:57PM EST until February 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Cuyahoga River At Old Portage affecting Summit County. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cuyahoga River...including Old Portage, Independence...Major flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Major flooding is forecast. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Cuyahoga River At Independence. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Property along Canal, Frances, Murray, Rockside, and Cloverleaf Roads in the village of Valley View inundated. Water extends to Commerce Parkway, Wall Street, Exchange Road, and Cloverleaf Parkway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 21.5 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.6 feet on 03/29/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning by 1100 AM EST.
